website_summaries.verdict: Philips' Go Light is more on the artistic than functional side, but it makes an excellent nightlight, side lamp or accent light. Hue colors are deep and vivid, and can be changed remotely through an app.
pros: Aesthetically pleasing "bowl of light," including a candle setting
Creates customizable back lighting for TV viewing
Wake-up alarm feature slowly brightens lamp
cons: Programming custom effects can be a challenge

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea, but battery life sucks.
customer_reviews.text: This light is a cool idea, but the battery life is horrid. It says that it can be "up to 3 hours". That could only be possible if the light was set to the dimmest setting, which practically you probably wouldnt do. So I keep it plugged in most of the time. When its plugged in it doesnt sit up all that well, in which case its just pointing straight up. I love Philips Hue products, but this was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: HERE'S A GREAT TIP IF YOU ARE USING HUE WITH AMAZON ECHO ...
customer_reviews.text: im obsessed with my hue go's. especially the candle setting. HERE'S A GREAT TIP IF YOU ARE USING HUE WITH AMAZON ECHO (ALEXA): put the candle setting on by tapping the back of the hue go, and then tell alexa to raise the light to 100%. now you have a bright and flickering candle instead of a dim one. if you try to raise the brightness in the hue app, it will just raise the brightness and keep it solid color :-)
customer_reviews.author: Peter J Ferris

customer_reviews.title: I love lamp!
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I love lamp! Produces a decent amount of light and the color range is amazing. Unfortunately it does require a Philips Hub to take advantages of wireless control and color changing. If you don't have a hub you can still change the colors by using the button on the back of the light. I have read numerous reviews saying the light won't sit on it's side plugged it. Those are false. Rotate the power cord and the light actually uses the plug as a stand. Note, it is a little snug so be careful when unplugging it. 1st generation Amazon Echos require a Hub to use voice control. The Echo Plus (2nd gen) has a built in hub.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable lights
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Really good color variation and brightness, they can even be used as strobes. I have a dozen of them in a piece of furniture designed for shoes and control them using the Hue Disco app on my iphone. Another excellent Philips Hue product.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Not really sure I know what I was thinking when ...
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure I know what I was thinking when I bought this. So far I can't really find a thing in my house to use this for. Also, I can't get it to sit at an angle if it is plugged in. (as in the photo they use to show the product). It will sit at an angle unplugged, but I am not going to unplug it just for that. Probably should have returned it but maybe I will think of something to do with it eventually.
customer_reviews.author: M. Whisman

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!! No replacement cord available.
customer_reviews.text: Had this light for a while now. My son loved it. Sadly my wife knocked it off the table it landed on the cord and cut it completely in half. Contacted manufacturer's customer service. They do not have replacement power cords. You can not purchase them. Told me to look for 3rd party solution (Just Wow). The plug is proprietary so if power cord is damaged no way to use light. I am not one to write reviews but this is unacceptable. A $70 light is now garbage. Just be aware that if cord is damaged light is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for lighting in my gamer room. I didn't want to pull the trigger on getting a $200 set up just for background lighting. After watching youtube reviews of all the phillips lighting products, I chose to go with this one. All I wanted was the color behind my monitor. For that purpose, it works perfectly. I can adjust the shade to whatever I want and it looks super cool. *The photo doesn't do the color justice, but you get the general idea.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Works with Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: I love this light! I have a tiny guest room that needed a bedside lamp/nightlight. And this hue go is perfect - clean design. Also, i was able to hook up this light to Alexa with the hue bridge 2. So now I just ask Alexa to turn on my hue go, dim it, turn it off, etc. Love it!!! Awesome as a night light, for ambience - mood setting, and as a reading light.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't sure what to expect
customer_reviews.text: If you know what you want to use this for, it might be worth it. The colors are excellent. I have two hue bloom lights and I thought this would be similar and maybe a little more versatile. It really isn't a good replacement for a bloom light. I haven't found a good use for having a portable light, and the location of the plug makes it awkward to position when it's plugged in. I'd rather have another bloom light.
customer_reviews.author: Speed

customer_reviews.title: Potentially a good product, but for now not so great
customer_reviews.text: If you need a color changing portable light that lasts as long as your yoga practice (about 1 hour) then this is the perfect lamp. Else, it just has too many other limitations to be practical. It doesn't stand up well when plugged in because of cord placement - always wanted to roll on its back. Also, didn't turn on using app or Alexa sometimes when charged but not plugged in. Could be a nice bedside lamp too - but DC converter should be inside lamp housing rather than a large brick plugged into wall. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: jwf

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for its look, and being a protable light to match my current RGB fix. however the construction felt off, sort of flimsy, and although you need a seperate purchase to be able to control it remotely, i still feel this could have used a standalone option vs pressing the button, quickly, slowly, hold, or long press. overall it was an expensive light to purchase if your not invested into the HUE ecosystem,
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jurado

customer_reviews.title: Wished this could run off the battery and be controlled ...
customer_reviews.text: Wished this could run off the battery and be controlled via a motion sensor - but after an hour or two the Go goes to sleep mode and wont turn on via the motion sensor. Wanted to make it my bathroom night light in a location where there wasn't an outlet.
customer_reviews.author: B Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced. It’s alright. Bright enough just too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Cool at first but honestly there’s a lot of better options for MUCH less. Too expensive and kinda ugly to be honest. Again cool thing at first but over time just lost its coolness. Sits behind my tv now and I can say I’ve used it’s wireless feature like twice. I never really feel the need to move it...just me. It works and it’s decently bright no issues there just for the money not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JMPino Photo

customer_reviews.title: Great for Power Outages!
customer_reviews.text: Although a little over priced, the Phillips Hue Go is one of my favorite Hue products. I keep it plugged in most of the time, but sometimes I like to bring it out for parties and set it on a table. It looks really good whether it's hidden behind a mirror for ambient lighting, or on a table/shelf for parties. During power outages, the battery is still available for a little while so you can find your flashlight. It's a really cool device and super convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: This has probably saved me from really bad S.A.D
customer_reviews.text: This has probably saved me from S.A.D. I get bad seasonal affective disorder during the winter months and use this for the sunrise alarm effect. It's cheaper than a "happy light" and had worked twice as well. Of course it does much more and I enjoy playing with the colors but I'm most impressed by how it has helped my health.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Heads up - these have a "candle" mode, which ...
customer_reviews.text: Heads up - these have a "candle" mode, which is a slight wavering of the light in an ultra low mode. Don't think your light is broken - it's just in candle mode... :)
customer_reviews.author: Matt P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to my lights setup
customer_reviews.text: The Philips Hue Go is somewhat perfect albeit a highly, highly overpriced device. I got them on sale so saved a few bucks. I wanted to add them to my TV game room setup since I already had invested in the Philips hue bridge and color/white lights earlier this year. I don't use the lights on battery as they drain out fairly quickly (~1.5 hrs), but these lights stay on during brief/emergency power cuts. The other point I would highlight is that be very gentle when connecting/removing the power cord to the device since it feels flimsy and feels like it will either break or damage the internals.
customer_reviews.author: mkr

customer_reviews.title: These lights do NOT work at all as a rechargeable Light!
customer_reviews.text: I got 3 of these because they’re rechargeable to use for power outages. These lights have been plugged in since the day they were delivered. Well...there’s a power outage right now and NONE of these lights turn on AT ALL. Pissed!
customer_reviews.author: The Bean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lamp to light up any space
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these lamps; one on top of a bookcase, one on top of my refrigerator. Their reflected light really brightens what would otherwise be a darker kitchen and living room. My apartment is like a bowling ally, so it's often difficult to conventionally place lamps. These HUE lights let me get creative, and tying them all to a Hue switch makes it even better.
customer_reviews.author: Misanthrope

customer_reviews.title: Add a little color to your life!
customer_reviews.text: Added some automation to my home. Love being able to have Siri set the brightness level. I use 3 primary settings. One when I wake up so I can see on my way out the door, one that lights up the house when I hit the Geofence (no more leaving on the lights or coming home to a dark house!), and finally, one that gives off a warm color set to wind down at the end of the night. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anson

customer_reviews.title: Better and better over time.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this Philips had a few updates to the hub as well as the software. Overall with each release the functionality keeps improving. When I first got it some of my Hue lights had trouble syncing and obeying the commands for color change, on and off. Scheduled home is now working too. So far, I love it. The bubs are unfortunately expensive but when you have them all setup, it creates great ambiance.
customer_reviews.author: KissingTaco

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be brighter
customer_reviews.text: I use this lamp as an accent lamp behind my surround sound subwoofer. It works well. Never have any issues with it but I do wish it would get brighter or do a better job of projecting the light. If this type of lighting is your goal, I would personally look into the various other Phillip hue products. I use mine plugged in all the time so I’m not positive about the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Foster

customer_reviews.title: The best lite for bed room ever.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this lights on night stands in bedroom. Set up control with Alexa. The only disappointment with this lights that it require to purchase additional Philips hub to run control from you smartphone or voice commands with Alexa. I did not expect this from lamps with such high end cost. I believe wifi controls should be embedded in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the light itself but you can't sit it at ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the light itself but you can't sit it at an angle (which is my favorite position) of its plugged in and even fully charged, it doesn't stay on for nearly as long as its supposed to so it really needs to be plugged in 95% of the time
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Heather

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: Love these little guys. Light where ever I want. And whatever color I want. Doesn't get hot, and they are just plain fun. Admittedly a little expensive. But it's not a "need" item I just really wanted it.
customer_reviews.author: brian ballestamon

customer_reviews.title: love this light
customer_reviews.text: I love this light. I have it plugged in and don't really utilize the battery option but it's nice to know it's there in case I want to travel with it. It's very cool looking and I'm so glad I got it. The colors are and quality are generation three and it shows. Again, love this light
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Winston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light! Super bright
customer_reviews.text: Awesome light! Super bright. When I first turned it on, I was shocked how bright it is. It is my first Phillps Hue product. The packaging was top notch and I got free one day shipping! Absolutely love this light. Works great on your desk, night stand for a reading light, kitchen, living room, etc. Pros: Quality, bright, minimalist clean design, variety of colors. Cons: Price.
customer_reviews.author: Chawlzz

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: I love this lamp. It is entirely pointless and I absolutely did not need it, but I love it. I feel like a wizard when I hold it, its like a magical colorful crystal ball and its fantastic. It adds a lovely glow on our wall that fills me with joy. I also really like that its wireless, so we can bring it outside. I had a lovely night this summer lying in our hammock with my magical glow next to me. I think everyone should have a fun magic lamp, they are just great!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Very cool item... I think...
customer_reviews.text: This is great but I'm not quite sure what to do it yet I hopefully with some IFFFT I can come up with some cool rules and some meditation the one thing that is discouraging is that unplugged you are automatically reduced 40% power, which doesn't really make sense to me for a "GO" portable device, but it's cool if you have arbitrary money to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Beeved

customer_reviews.title: Phillips hue universe
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve invested in Phillips hue universe this is a great addition especially if the power goes out with the rechargeable battery. The hue lights/bulbs will cost you but I’ve never had any issues with them. Now that the house is pretty much completed I’m happy with all of the hue products.
customer_reviews.author: PoussoNR

customer_reviews.title: Not bright at its brightest.
customer_reviews.text: Plus is that it works with Alexa and I can go to bed without having to stumble in the dark after turning the light off at the door. Big negative, though, is that I have to use the overhead light if I am working in my room, doing laundry, or anything I actually need light to see by. This is not brought at all. For the price you should not have to use a separate light if you actually want to see.
customer_reviews.author: mickles

customer_reviews.title: Charging life is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Product is great when it works. But it runs out of charge so quickly that I don't know why they bother to call it portable. I should have returned it but missed the deadline. I love all of my Philips Hue Lights but this one was a total waste of money. I don't know what I can do about it now at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Delacey

customer_reviews.title: I like my Hue Go!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hue Go in our growing family of Hue lights. It may not be the best in color intensity but I appreciate the fact that it stays lit during a power outage and is very easy to disconnect and take outside. I like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Nightowl

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I have a house full of Hue lights. I am not quite sure what the purpose of this light is? It is quite small. It is on my desk. Does not give off enough light to be of use for reading. As for the different 'types' of light for example, energizing, again just too small. I have othe color lights in the office set to energize and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Moyer

customer_reviews.title: High price point but performs better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly bright, paired quickly and smoothly joined the existing Hue household. Previously considered buying but couldn’t justify the price point. Then, coincidentally, the price dropped the day after our power had gone out at night during a storm... And we knew this was what we needed! No regrets!
customer_reviews.author: jkizer82

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy laying these out around the house or garden, adjusting the light for brightness to read, or coolness to soothe....
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Had bought one on a whim. Quickly bought another. Plug it in, turn it on, charge it up. You can put it anywhere, and set the color to Bright Reading Light or Cool Blue Soothing Light, or green or purple.... Lot of fun to play with and put about the house or garden....
customer_reviews.author: VideoDemon

customer_reviews.title: Decent but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Decent product. Works on battery for a short time. Yes, it does talk to Alexa, but there are far cheaper - programmable - multi colored lights available. Price for this is my primary reason for only three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift I've seen in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I love this light, it is so versatile. It will sink with the other lights connected to the bridgfe. The battery last about 2hours depending on the color selected. I love the candle flicker at low settings. Very soothing, absolutely great gift for someone with or without the bridge. If user has no bridge the light can be adjusted by button press combinations. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, until my husband lost the charging cord
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, until my husband lost the charging cord. I’ve searched the internet for a replacement, they CAN’T be found!! I’ve even tried reaching out to the Phillips Company, haven’t heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Jonehl

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lamp, works as expected, it has a convenient bottom button for turn it up if Internet is gone. Expensive, yes, I found myself not using it as I expected but still a nice product. The one thing I don't like too much is that batteries don't last long, even if not using the lamp you need to have it plugged, otherwise when you need to used it it is dead.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Great portable light
customer_reviews.text: The Philip hue go is it great little portable light made very premium.. battery life is not bad it lasted a few hours.. very bright beautiful rainbow colors..very good gadget I haven't went to have visitors in the living room so I could use those lights and turn off the main lights
customer_reviews.author: Rayson Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Handy. At a premium.
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like this little guy. It's fairly useful, except the stand can be tricky when it's plugged in. 🙄🙄🙄 But I can honestly say it's not worth the price when you consider the battery is meh. I got mine on sale. At full price I'd be fully perturbed.
customer_reviews.author: AJN

customer_reviews.title: Motion Detection?
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I set this up wrong, but this Hue Go does not detect motion.... It is nice to have but I think it's way too expensive for what it is. I also find the fact that it does not have a stand very inconvinient because in order for the light to be at it's fullest potential of brightness, it must be plugged into the outlet. The cord gets directly in the way and it takes a few tries to position the light.
customer_reviews.author: Caro❤️

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful smart home addition.
customer_reviews.text: I love Hue products. As always, this one does not disappoint. I have one on each side of my tv and it adds such a relaxing and calming accent to the layout. I use them with the hue tv app to have the colors change with the tv show/movies. The lights can pulse. And the lights aren’t overwhelming. I would recommend the go. It’s worth the cost and a great addition to my smart home.
customer_reviews.author: LynnieTheGooner

customer_reviews.title: Works Great With Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bedside light I can turn on remotely so I won’t stumble coming to bed. And I set it to a pleasing level of brightness and color which does not disturb my already sleeping wife.
customer_reviews.author: Hecker001

customer_reviews.title: Not to be used in Norway and or Europe!
customer_reviews.text: As almost all Philips Hue products, they are great. I do not recommend it to be used in Europe, if you buy it from the US. I bought it here and got it shipped to Norway and the voltage didn't match and hence did not work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Yashakur

customer_reviews.title: Fancy and practical
customer_reviews.text: Great and looking fancy. The only downside is that while charging it, you cannot place it steadily in the upright position, the charger cable stands on the way..it gives wonderful light and I love the candlelight effect
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it for anything other than lighting up a wall to add color against the rest of my hue lights. As a plus, It can be used other places as well (without a cord). Your paying for top notch quality and it lives up to the hype.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: It works but the battery life is not so good. If you get one you'll likely end up ...
customer_reviews.text: It works but the battery life is not so good. If you get one you'll likely end up having it plugged in 99.9% of the time for that reason. That being the case I'm not convinced this is really worth the price. If I had it to do over again I'd likely buy a second Bloom.
customer_reviews.author: Randomtasks

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay... not very bright
customer_reviews.text: Okay, the hue brand is cool and all it’s uniqueness, but I expected more. This is a great mood light, but even on a full charge, the battery won’t last but maybe 40 mins and it’s not as bright as I’d like.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get a refurbished model
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I’ve gotten a refurbed Philips Hue item (first was a Bridge) that wasn’t functional. I don’t think they actually test them before shipping them out despite the Certified stickers stuck to the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Liz B.

customer_reviews.title: AC adapter location is terrible, very limited options for positioning l.
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool addition to my Hue setup, but what in the heck were the engineers thinking with the AC adapter connector location and other mounting options. The location of the AC adapter insert is completely stupid, caused the whole thing to wobble, plus there are really no other mounting / positioning options other then straight up.
customer_reviews.author: JMS Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: cool but expensive
customer_reviews.text: They work great and controlling them via iphone is easy using the app. When using the color hue wheel, i noticed the color blue/orange is not as deep as other colors eg red. And expensive for sure and so -1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Xan

customer_reviews.title: Bad design choices
customer_reviews.text: To not be able to keep the lamp connected with the cable for charging is a pretty bad design choice. Not expected for such an overprices item. Also the switch to turn it on/off is pretty inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed plug and adjacent small protrusion used to position light at an angle. Colors don't mix well using the color wheel on the app. Very poor battery life.
customer_reviews.author: William Payne

customer_reviews.title: Beatiful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lamp for a present for my brother and sister in law. They love it! They are happy with this lamp, they use the app to control the light.
customer_reviews.author: Nieves Barrera

customer_reviews.title: I love the hue go
customer_reviews.text: I love the hue go!! its amazing. I use mine behind the couch to light up the corner of the wall it adds a great vibe to the room and I just purchased the bloom when it went on sale too so I cant wait to try that out!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony John Guerra

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful atmosphere
customer_reviews.text: This light is lovely. I don't have it hooked up to the whole Hue system but even alone it is a beautiful addition to my home lighting. The different lighting modes are all pleasant and the portability is so cool. I do not consider it bright enough to fully light a good sized room, but it would do for a smaller room. In a larger room it adds atmosphere and color. I plan to get more!
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work great with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Not as bright as I thought it was going to be. More disappointing is that Alexa is only able to communicate with it around 40% of the time. If this does not improve, I’ll be returning it. FYI, you can’t change the color or brightness through Alexa... or at least mine isn’t able to.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Skip it.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to use because you need to purchase additional parts. Very expensive toy. Unless you’re ready to dump money into this, skip it. Definitely do your research about what you need first. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Marilu

customer_reviews.title: Fun novelty
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on sale for occasional porch use. I like the button to quickly change settings. It does not stand up with cord attached which is a really stupid design flaw. Battery lasts ok.
customer_reviews.author: Harv

customer_reviews.title: I like this lamp and it light effects
customer_reviews.text: I like this lamp and it light effects, however to fully enjoy all its features another accesory is needed, hence the 4 stars, the app should control the lamp right out of the box...bummer, otherwise nice toy to illuminate you...
customer_reviews.author: Dr. C.

customer_reviews.title: Never use stairwell light switch again!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this as a stairwell light with motion sensors at top and bottom of stairs. Setup was easy and a little testing on sensor timing was required. Never have to stop and hit switch again in hallway or when hands are full going up/down stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Hue
customer_reviews.text: Of all my Zigbee lighting products, the Hue Go lamps are my favorite. You can put them anywhere, shine them on anything, and with 16 million colors and the ability to change your mind on location whenever you feel like it, these are really amazing
customer_reviews.author: Edward O

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice addition to my hue eco system. I can move it around, set it to any room to augment the scenes. Very bright and amazing colors.

customer_reviews.title: Cons: Battery life and lack of features without purchasing accessories
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is disappointing-as is the fact that you cannot have it stay a solid color without the bridge and a smartphone. I like the light, Philips just needs to improve the battery life and make it more functional as a stand alone product to make it worth the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lee

customer_reviews.title: The lamp only works plugged in

customer_reviews.author: James Muller

customer_reviews.text: I purchase this as an open box item and it works great. I am very happy with it. It connects well with the app and the lighting creates a great backlight behind my tv. Would not hesitate to buy again!

customer_reviews.text: Wish it had more light output, but it's a good supplement to the other Philips lights we have around the home.

customer_reviews.text: It’s super cool, but I don’t think it’s practical to take portably. I wasn’t planning on it, so it’s exactly what I needed. I’m planning on getting at least two more when they go on sale again.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
